trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when modifications to object instances cannot be persisted to the data source.
For more information about how to handle exceptions in your code, see <xref:System.Exception>.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Data.UpdateException"></xref>.
For more information about how to handle exceptions in your code, see <xref:System.Exception>.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Data.UpdateException"></xref> with a specialized error message.
For more information about how to handle exceptions in your code, see <xref:System.Exception>.
The message that describes the error.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Data.UpdateException"></xref> with serialized data.
For more information about how to handle exceptions in your code, see <xref:System.Exception>.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.UpdateException"></xref> class that uses a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
For more information about how to handle exceptions in your code, see <xref:System.Exception>.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if no inner exception is specified.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.UpdateException"></xref> class that uses a specified error message, a reference to the inner exception, and an enumerable collection of <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> objects.
For more information about how to handle exceptions in your code, see <xref:System.Exception>.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if no inner exception is specified.
The collection of <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> objects.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> objects for this <xref href="System.Data.UpdateException"></xref>.
For more information about how to handle exceptions in your code, see <xref:System.Exception>.
A collection of <xref href="System.Data.Objects.ObjectStateEntry"></xref> objects comprised of either a single entity and 0 or more relationships, or 0 entities and 1 or more relationships.
